newsitem.title: LEBANON: Lebanon's mid-year banking activity up - Bank.
newsitem.headline: Lebanon's mid-year banking activity up - Bank.

text.p: The consolidated balance sheet of Lebanon's commercial banks' rose to 30,963 billion Lebanese pounds in mid-1996, Lebanon's Banks Association said in its latest bulletin.
The consolidated sheet of Lebanon's 82 banks stood at 29,055 billion pounds at the end of 1995, the bulletin said.
Deposits rose to 26,578 billion pounds from 25,145 billion pounds at the end of 1995, it said.
Lebanese pound deposits rose to 10,873 billion pounds at the end of June from 9,255 billion pounds at the end of 1995.
Deposits in foreign currencies grew by $660 million to $9.990 billion in June compared with $9.230 billion at the end of 1995.
Dollarisation of bank deposits registered 59.07 percent against 61.76 percent at the end 1995.
Loans and credits to the private sector rose by 1,274 billion pounds at the end of June over the end December 1995 -- increasing to 11,969 billion pounds from 10,695 billion.
